segment.source: Updating a MED-V Workspace Image
segment.target: Updating a MED-V Workspace Image

segment.source: Updating a MED-V Workspace Image
segment.target: Updating a MED-V Workspace Image

segment.source: Updating a MED-V Workspace Image
segment.target: Updating a MED-V Workspace Image

segment.source: An image can be updated in one of the following ways:
segment.target: An image can be updated in one of the following ways:

segment.source: The update can be pushed to the guest operating system using your enterprise software distribution system.
segment.target: The update can be pushed to the guest operating system using your enterprise software distribution system.

segment.source: The update can be uploaded to the image Web distribution server, and then downloaded by the client and applied to the MED-V image.
segment.target: The update can be uploaded to the image Web distribution server, and then downloaded by the client and applied to the MED-V image.

segment.source: The MED-V base image can be updated and redeployed.
segment.target: The MED-V base image can be updated and redeployed.

segment.source: How to Update a MED-V Image Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System
segment.target: How to Update a MED-V Image Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System

segment.source: To update a MED-V image using an enterprise software distribution system
segment.target: To update a MED-V image using an enterprise software distribution system

segment.source: Refer to the documentation of the system you are using.
segment.target: Refer to the documentation of the system you are using.

segment.source: How to Update a MED-V Image Using Web Download
segment.target: How to Update a MED-V Image Using Web Download

segment.source: To update a MED-V image using Web download
segment.target: To update a MED-V image using Web download

segment.source: In MED-V management, on the Virtual Machine tab, ensure that the following settings are applied to the MED-V workspace policies that are associated with the MED-V image being updated:
segment.target: In MED-V management, on the Virtual Machine tab, ensure that the following settings are applied to the MED-V workspace policies that are associated with the MED-V image being updated:

segment.source: The Suggest update when a new version is available check box is selected.
segment.target: The Suggest update when a new version is available check box is selected.

segment.source: Optionally, the Clients should use Trim Transfer when downloading images for this Workspace check box is selected.
segment.target: Optionally, the Clients should use Trim Transfer when downloading images for this Workspace check box is selected.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace.

segment.source: Upload the image update to the image Web distribution server.
segment.target: Upload the image update to the image Web distribution server.

segment.source: All clients with images that need to be updated automatically download the update and apply it to the image.
segment.target: All clients with images that need to be updated automatically download the update and apply it to the image.

segment.source: How to Update a MED-V Base Image
segment.target: How to Update a MED-V Base Image

segment.source: To update a MED-V base image
segment.target: To update a MED-V base image

segment.source: Open the existing image in Virtual PC 2007.
segment.target: Open the existing image in Virtual PC 2007.

segment.source: Make the required changes to the image, updating the image (such as installing new software).
segment.target: Make the required changes to the image, updating the image (such as installing new software).

segment.source: Close Virtual PC 2007.
segment.target: Close Virtual PC 2007.

segment.source: Test the image.
segment.target: Test the image.

segment.source: After the image is tested, pack it to the local repository, using the same name as the existing image.
segment.target: After the image is tested, pack it to the local repository, using the same name as the existing image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you name the image a different name than the existing version, a new image will be created rather than a new version of the existing image.
segment.target: If you name the image a different name than the existing version, a new image will be created rather than a new version of the existing image.

segment.source: Upload the new version to the server, push it to the image pre-stage folder, or distribute it via a deployment package.
segment.target: Upload the new version to the server, push it to the image pre-stage folder, or distribute it via a deployment package.
